channel.title: Removing from a Binary Search Tree :: Data Structures in C#
channel.description: Removing from a Binary Search Tree Before we can discuss how to remove an element from a binary search tree, we must first define exactly how we want the method to behave. Consider first the case in which the tree is built from immutable nodes. We are given a key and a binary search tree, and we want to return the result of removing the element having the given key. However, we need to decide what we will do if there is no element having the given key.
